subject: Medicine
title: Doctor-Patient Confidentiality
description: A tiny lesson with a big payoff: Doctor-Patient Confidentiality.

hook.text: A patient confesses a crime to their doctor. The doctor cannot tell police. Confidentiality is that strong.

buildup.text: Medical confidentiality means doctors cannot share patient information without consent.

discovery.text: It exists so patients feel safe disclosing everythingâ€”even embarrassing or illegal detailsâ€”to get proper care.

twist.text: There are exceptions: if a patient threatens to harm someone, doctors may be legally required to warn the target.

climax.text: The Tarasoff case established that the duty to protect others can override the duty of confidentiality.

punchline.text: Trust is sacredâ€”but safety can override it.

quiz.question: When can a doctor break patient confidentiality?
options: When a patient poses a credible threat to harm others
Whenever the doctor disagrees with the patient's choices
Only when law enforcement requests medical records
